snippet: At the Palestinian territory’s film festival, Hamas has the final cut on all the movies and insists the lights stay on to avoid any hanky-panky among the audience.
abstract: Red Carpet Human Rights Film Festival, in its second year in Gaza City, treads delicate line between freedom of expression and conforming to social mores imposed by Hamas and Islamic society.

byline.original: By DIAA HADID and MAJD AL WAHEIDI

lead_paragraph: At the Palestinian territory’s film festival, Hamas has the final cut on all the movies and insists the lights stay on to avoid any hanky-panky among the audience.

headline.main: The House Lights, if Not the Stars, Shine Bright at Gaza’s Film Festival
headline.print_headline: The House Lights, if Not the Stars, Shine Bright at a Gaza Film Festival
